00001 // Vector Class    by Alan Baylis 2001
00002 
00003 #ifndef _Vector_H
00004 #define _Vector_H
00005 
00006 #include <math.h>
00007 
00008 // A floating point number
00009 typedef float SCALAR;
00010 
00011 class VECTOR
00012 {
00013     public:
00014            VECTOR(float sx = 0, float sy = 0, float sz = 0);
00015           ~VECTOR();
00016 
00017         float GetMagnitude();
00018         void Normalize();
00019         void Reset();
00020           void Set(float sx, float sy, float sz) {x = sx, y = sy, z = sz;}
00021         void CrossVector(VECTOR vect);
00022         float DotProduct(VECTOR vect);
00023 
00024         //equal within an error ‘e’
00025         const bool nearlyEquals( const VECTOR& v, const SCALAR e ) const
00026         {
00027             return fabs(x-v.x)<e && fabs(y-v.y)<e && fabs(z-v.z)<e;
00028         }
00029 
00030         //cross product
00031         const VECTOR cross( const VECTOR& v ) const
00032         {
00033             //Davis, Snider, "Introduction to Vector Analysis", p. 44
00034             return VECTOR( y*v.z - z*v.y, z*v.x - x*v.z, x*v.y - y*v.x );
00035         }
00036 
00037         //scalar dot product
00038         const SCALAR dot( const VECTOR& v ) const
00039         {
00040             return x*v.x + y*v.y + z*v.z;
00041         }
00042 
00043         //length
00044         const SCALAR length() const
00045         {
00046             return (SCALAR)sqrt( (double)this->dot(*this) );
00047         }
00048 
00049         //unit vector
00050         const VECTOR unit() const
00051         {
00052             return (*this) / length();
00053         }
00054 
00055         //make this a unit vector
00056         void normalize()
00057         {
00058             (*this) /= length();
00059         }
00060 
00061         //Members
00062           float x;
00063         float y;
00064         float z;
00065 
00066         //index a component
00067         //NOTE: returning a reference allows
00068         //you to assign the indexed element
00069         SCALAR& operator [] ( const long i )
00070         {
00071             return *((&x) + i);
00072         }
00073 
00074         //compare
00075         const bool operator == ( const VECTOR& v ) const
00076         {
00077             return (v.x==x && v.y==y && v.z==z);
00078         }
00079 
00080         const bool operator != ( const VECTOR& v ) const
00081         {
00082             return !(v == *this);
00083         }
00084 
00085         //negate
00086         const VECTOR operator - () const
00087         {
00088             return VECTOR( -x, -y, -z );
00089         }
00090 
00091         //assign
00092         const VECTOR& operator = ( const VECTOR& v )
00093         {
00094             x = v.x;
00095             y = v.y;
00096             z = v.z;
00097             return *this;
00098         }
00099 
00100         //increment
00101         const VECTOR& operator += ( const VECTOR& v )
00102         {
00103             x+=v.x;
00104             y+=v.y;
00105             z+=v.z;
00106             return *this;
00107         }
00108 
00109         //decrement
00110         const VECTOR& operator -= ( const VECTOR& v )
00111         {
00112             x-=v.x;
00113             y-=v.y;
00114             z-=v.z;
00115             return *this;
00116         }
00117 
00118         //self-multiply
00119         const VECTOR& operator *= ( const SCALAR& s )
00120         {
00121             x*=s;
00122             y*=s;
00123             z*=s;
00124             return *this;
00125         }
00126 
00127         //self-divide
00128         const VECTOR& operator /= ( const SCALAR& s )
00129         {
00130             const SCALAR r = 1 / s;
00131             x *= r;
00132             y *= r;
00133             z *= r;
00134             return *this;
00135         }
00136 
00137         //add
00138         const VECTOR operator + ( const VECTOR& v ) const
00139         {
00140             return VECTOR(x + v.x, y + v.y, z + v.z);
00141         }
00142 
00143         //subtract
00144         const VECTOR operator - ( const VECTOR& v ) const
00145         {
00146             return VECTOR(x - v.x, y - v.y, z - v.z);
00147         }
00148 
00149         //post-multiply by a scalar
00150         const VECTOR operator * ( const SCALAR& s ) const
00151         {
00152             return VECTOR( x*s, y*s, z*s );
00153         }
00154 
00155         //pre-multiply by a scalar
00156         friend inline const VECTOR operator * ( const SCALAR& s, const VECTOR& v )
00157         {
00158             return v * s;
00159         }
00160 
00161         //divide
00162         const VECTOR operator / (SCALAR s) const
00163         {
00164             s = 1/s;
00165             return VECTOR( s*x, s*y, s*z );
00166         }
00167 };
00168 
00169 #endif
